required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness and Cost-utility of a Complex Intervention for Fibromyalgia Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Primary Care as a Promoter of the Quality of Life of Fibromyalgia Patients. Effectiveness and Cost-utility of a Complex Intervention Through a Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Fibromyalgia (FM) is a chronic disease characterized by chronic pain, fatigue and loss of function that leads to a significant deterioration in the quality of life. Despite controversies about the most appropriate treatment, studies indicate that a multidisciplinary treatment would be effective. This study aims to analyze the effectiveness and cost-utility of a complex intervention in the quality of life (main variable), the functional impact, the mood and the pain of people with FM treated in the Primary Care Teams (PCTs) of the Catalan Institute of Health (CIH).

detailed_description.textblock:
Methods and analysis: Mixed methodology study following the recommendations of the Medical Research Council, with two phases. Phase 1: Randomized pragmatic clinical trial with patients diagnosed with FM and assigned to one of the 11 PCTs of the CIH (Territorial management of "Terras del Ebro"). A total sample of 336 patients is estimated.
The usual clinical practice will be carried out in the control group and the usual practice and the complex treatment, in the intervention group. The complex treatment will be based on health education, aerobic physical exercise and cognitive-behavioral therapy, during 12 weeks in sessions of 2 hours/week. Statistical analysis: Assessment of the standardized mean response and of the size of the standardized effect and multivariate logistic regression analysis will be performed. The economic analysis will be based on useful measures. Phase 2: Qualitative socio-constructivist study to identify the improvement aspects of the intervention according to the results obtained and the opinions and experiences of the participants (patients and professionals). The sampling will be theoretical with 2 discussion groups composed of participants in the intervention and 2 discussion groups of professionals from different PCTs.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from life quality at 3, 9 and 15 months after the beginning of the study
primary_outcome.description: to be evaluated with the health questionnaire (SF-36v2). It will be measured by a scale Likert: 0 (worst) to 100 (best).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in functional impact of fibromyalgia
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from functional impact of fibromyalgia at 3, 9 and 15 months after the beginning of the study.
primary_outcome.description: to be evaluated with the Revised Questionnaire on the Impact of Fibromyalgia (FIQR) It will be measured by a scale Likert: 0 (best) to 100 (worst).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from tender points at 3, 9 and 15 months after the beginning of the study.
primary_outcome.description: Tender points evaluate the presence of pain in 18 areas of the body and will be measured by a scale Likert: 0 (best) to 18 (worst).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analog Scale for pain (VAS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from VAS at 3, 9 and 15 months after the beginning of the study.
primary_outcome.description: The VAS evaluates the self-perceived intensity of pain by a scale Likert: 0 (absence of pain) to 10 (worst possible pain).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from mood indicator (anxiety) at 3, 9 and 15 months after the beginning of the study.
primary_outcome.description: To be evaluated with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) questionnaire. The scale likert punctuates from 0 to 21 (8 to 10 indicates a doubtful case of anxiety; more than 11 indicates a probable case of anxiety).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from mood indicator (depression) at 3, 9 and 15 months after the beginning of the study.
primary_outcome.description: To be evaluated with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) questionnaire. The scale likert punctuates from 0 to 21 (8 to 10 indicates a doubtful case of anxiety; more than 11 indicates a probable case of anxiety).

secondary_outcome.description: age, sex, level of education, work disability and family coexistence

Physical manifestations to be evaluated: non-repairing sleep, excessive fatigue, dryness of mucous membranes, Raynaud's phenomenon, Intolerance to olfactory and auditory stimuli, cephalgia lumbar, increased sensitivity to the side effects of drugs and paresthesia of hands and feet. To be evaluated with a questionnaire (yes/no type)

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence/absence of physical or psychic trigger factor of fibromyalgia
secondary_outcome.description: To be evaluated with a questionnaire (yes/no type)

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence/absence of physical, psychic or psychological factor responsible for fibromyalgia maintenance
secondary_outcome.description: To be evaluated with a questionnaire (yes/no type)

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence/absence of family history of fibromyalgia
secondary_outcome.description: To be evaluated with a questionnaire (yes/no type)

secondary_outcome.measure: presence/absence of cognitive psychological symptoms: Difficulty for concentration, alteration of memory
secondary_outcome.description: To be evaluated with a questionnaire (yes/no type)

secondary_outcome.measure: presence/absence of comorbidities: Chronic pelvic pain, dysmenorrhoea, irritable bladder syndrome, myofascial pain
secondary_outcome.description: To be evaluated with a questionnaire (yes/no type)
diagnosis date of fibromyalgia
years of evolution of fibromyalgia

secondary_outcome.measure: presence/absence of pathological history: arthrosis, arthritis and mental health problems
secondary_outcome.description: To be evaluated with a questionnaire (yes/no type)

secondary_outcome.measure: Test of the thyroid stimulating hormone
secondary_outcome.description: Analytic results in milliunits per litre (mUI/L)
Analytic results of hemogram

secondary_outcome.measure: Glucose, creatinine and C-reactive protein tests
secondary_outcome.description: Analytic results of each test in mg/dl
Analytic results of each test
Analytic results in mm
Analytic results in IU/mL

secondary_outcome.time_frame: one year before the beginning of the intervention in comparison with one year after the beginning of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: antidepressants, analgesics and others

secondary_outcome.time_frame: one year before the beginning of the intervention in comparison with one year after the beginning of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: cost of visits to family doctor or nurse and cost of urgency visits

secondary_outcome.time_frame: one year before the beginning of the intervention in comparison with one year after the beginning of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: cost of referrals to external consultations

secondary_outcome.time_frame: one year before the beginning of the intervention in comparison with one year after the beginning of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: cost of lost productivity due to sick leave

arm_group.description: Participants in the intervention group will receive the complex treatment and the usual clinical practice.
Participants in the control group will receive the care from the usual clinical practice

intervention.description: The complex treatment will be based on health education, aerobic physical exercise and cognitive-behavioral therapy, during 12 weeks in sessions of 2 hours/week. The sessions will be conducted in the primary health care by trained professionals.
